title: Migos
summary: Migos (/ˈmiːɡoʊs/) are an American hip hop trio from Lawrenceville, Georgia, founded in 2008.[2] The group is composed of three rappers known by their stage names Quavo, Offset, and Takeoff. They are managed by Coach K, the former manager of Atlanta-based rappers Gucci Mane and Young Jeezy,[3] and frequently collaborate with producers such as Zaytoven, DJ Durel, Murda Beatz, and Buddah Bless.[4][5]
